posts.post_content:
Every time I see this card, I realize that in its place in the booster pack, I could have gotten any other uncommon and I would have been satisfied.   
To illustrate, I bought a box of Kamigawa boosters back when I had more money than brains. I have 4 of these from that box. I have 1 Sensei's Divining Top.  
  
That hurts.  
  
0/5

posts.post_content: The only possible use for this is if you want your life to be lowered. [Magus of the Mirror](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Magus of the Mirror)? Throw in something like [Phyrexian Unlife](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Unlife) to sink below 0 and score an instant kill. But I'm sure there are better enablers for that sort of combo

Posted By: Sasky (11/21/2010 7:27:21 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
A black Samurai? Bushido 2? Regeneration? Sign me up. It sounds awesome on paper, doesn't it?  
  
Then, suddenly, this happened. They went wrong at every turn. Overcosted, underpowered, and a ridiculously overpriced regeneration cost. Who would ever pay that to rescue thing? A regeneration cost like that might fly on something like Phyrexian Obliterator, but not for a blocker that occasionally pokes for a single point of damage.
posts.html:

Then, suddenly, this happened. They went wrong at every turn. Overcosted, underpowered, and a ridiculously overpriced regeneration cost. Who would ever pay that to rescue thing? A regeneration cost like that might fly on something like Phyrexian Obliterator, but not for a blocker that occasionally pokes for a single point of damage.

posts.post_content:
Black will do anything to win, therefore it will pay ![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol) and bleed you for 5 to keep your opponent on a 20-turn clock.  
This makes [Wood Elemental](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wood Elemental), [Aven Trooper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Aven Trooper), and [Viashino Skeleton](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Viashino Skeleton) look good. And it will get you killed faster than any of the aforementioned creatures.
posts.html:
Black will do anything to win, therefore it will pay and bleed you for 5 to keep your opponent on a 20-turn clock.
This makes Wood Elemental, Aven Trooper, and Viashino Skeleton look good. And it will get you killed faster than any of the aforementioned creatures.

Posted By: Trygon_Predator (5/15/2012 12:27:14 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I'd say this is worse than chimney imp.
  
   
So much about this card just doesn't make sense. Ok, add 1 CMC because it's a black samurai, fair enough. Ok, don't let it have regen for B because it's a human, not a zombie or troll or anything.
  
   
But even given those harsh restrictions, which would make the card pretty bad anyway, it should only be, say, CMC 3 1/1 bushido 2 with regen for 1B, or 0 mana and 3 life or something.
  
   
Seriously, what happened with this card? It's not just that it's bad, it's also /bizarre/. When do you ever seen a regen cost like that? Why does black get a bushido 2 1/1 anyway? What was the imagined purpose of this card, other than to be OBVIOUSLY bad?
  
   
Maybe that's it. Maybe they realised it was a bit naughty making cards that look good to newbies but are actually terrible, like wooden sphere, and decided to make a card that was offputting to EVERYONE.
  
   
Don't even get me started on the fact that this is uncommon. I guess we should be glad it wasn't a rare,... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
I'd say this is worse than chimney imp.

So much about this card just doesn't make sense. Ok, add 1 CMC because it's a black samurai, fair enough. Ok, don't let it have regen for B because it's a human, not a zombie or troll or anything.

But even given those harsh restrictions, which would make the card pretty bad anyway, it should only be, say, CMC 3 1/1 bushido 2 with regen for 1B, or 0 mana and 3 life or something.

Seriously, what happened with this card? It's not just that it's bad, it's also /bizarre/. When do you ever seen a regen cost like that? Why does black get a bushido 2 1/1 anyway? What was the imagined purpose of this card, other than to be OBVIOUSLY bad?

Maybe that's it. Maybe they realised it was a bit naughty making cards that look good to newbies but are actually terrible, like wooden sphere, and decided to make a card that was offputting to EVERYONE.

Don't even get me started on the fact that this is uncommon. I guess we should be glad it wasn't a rare,... (see all)

Posted By: The_Trendkill (10/21/2010 12:04:31 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
3/3 for ![3](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=3&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol) is "[hill giant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=hill giant)" status.   
1/1 with Bushido 2 of ![3](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=3&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol) is much worse then a hill giant.  
![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol) + 5 life to regenerate is a terrible ability, especially to save your worse then hill giant creature.  
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~  
Come on R&D. I know Mirrodin was bad, and you had to tone things down. But seriously, what were you thinking??? Everyone here took one glance at this card and said "No". I understand that you have to make some cards weaker then others, but there is no excuse for this.  
  
.5/5 for balancing and development.
posts.html:
3/3 for is "hill giant" status.
1/1 with Bushido 2 of is much worse then a hill giant.
+ 5 life to regenerate is a terrible ability, especially to save your worse then hill giant creature.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Posted By: azure_drake222222 (2/6/2013 3:14:09 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Paying life for regenerate is a cool mechanic, but obviously R&D were overly cautious here. Rightly so, I suppose though. Yeah, this card sucks, but there were quite a few 'pay life' abilities made back in the day that get out of hand really easily. Good examples being [Necropotence](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Necropotence), [Sylvan Library](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sylvan Library), [Channel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Channel) and [Hatred](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hatred). Obviously this card is no where near the level of the previously mentioned, but that's something to think about regarding paying life and balance.   
  
It'd be nice to see "Pay X life: Regenerate" return as an ability on like an Angel or something. Even cooler if that creature had lifelink.
posts.html:
Paying life for regenerate is a cool mechanic, but obviously R&D were overly cautious here. Rightly so, I suppose though. Yeah, this card sucks, but there were quite a few 'pay life' abilities made back in the day that get out of hand really easily. Good examples being Necropotence, Sylvan Library, Channel and Hatred. Obviously this card is no where near the level of the previously mentioned, but that's something to think about regarding paying life and balance.

It'd be nice to see "Pay X life: Regenerate" return as an ability on like an Angel or something. Even cooler if that creature had lifelink.
